title:
On countability of Teichm\"uller modular groups for analytically
  infinite Riemann surfaces defined by generalized Cantor sets
abstract:
For any analytically finite Riemann surface, the Teichm\"uller modular group
is countable, but it is not easy to find an analytically infinite Riemann
surface for which the Teichm\"uller modular group is countable. In this paper,
we show that the Teichm\"uller modular group is countable or uncountable for
some analytically infinite Riemann surfaces defined by generalized Cantor sets.
